definitions.definition: a small animal with soft fur that people often keep as a pet. Cats catch and kill birds and mice.

examples.text: a tin of cat food
I have a cat called Bo.
a pet/domestic cat
a stray/feral cat
Cats mark their territory by spraying.
The cat miaowed pitifully.
The cat slunk away into the darkness.
The cat was in constant pain so they had it put down.
The stray cats are wormed and treated with flea powder.
There was a cat yowling outside my window last night.
They didn't want kittens, so they had their cat spayed.
We have a pet cat called Archie.

phrases: play (a game of) cat and mouse

definitions.definition: a wild animal of the cat family

examples.text: the big cats *(= lions, , etc.)
She went to Africa to photograph big cats.

phrases: play (a game of) cat and mouse

definitions.definition: to be the best thing, person, idea, etc.

examples.text: He thinks he's the cat's whiskers *(= he has a high opinion of himself)*.

definitions.definition: said to somebody, especially a child, who stays silent when expected to speak, for example after being asked a question

examples.text: What's the matter? Cat got your tongue?

definitions.definition: used to tell somebody not to ask questions or try to find out about things that do not involve them
to be always arguing with each other

examples.text: In our childhood Irina and I fought like cat and dog.

definitions.definition: to tell a secret carelessly or by mistake

examples.text: I wanted it to be a surprise, but my sister let the cat out of the bag.
She was like a cat on a hot tin roof before her driving test.
She looked like a cat that’s got the cream. She was almost purring with pleasure.

definitions.definition: used to describe a very difficult task, especially one that involves organizing people

examples.text: Managing a political party is a lot like herding cats.

definitions.definition: when somebody says there’s no room to swing a cat, they mean that a room is very small and that there is not enough space
to have no chance at all
to play a cruel game with somebody in your power by changing your behaviour very often, so that they become nervous and do not know what to expect

examples.text: He thought the police were playing some elaborate game of cat and mouse and waiting to trap him.
Young car thieves enjoy playing cat and mouse with the police.

definitions.definition: to say or do something that is likely to cause trouble

examples.text: Then she told them she was dropping out of college. That really set the cat among the pigeons.

definitions.definition: there are many different ways to achieve something
people enjoy themselves more and behave with greater freedom when the person in charge of them is not there

wordOrigin: Old English catt, catte, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch kat and German Katze; reinforced in Middle English by forms from late Latin cattus.
